info.title: Chift API
info.description: The Chift API is a universal API giving you access to financial data from the software of your clients. It helps software companies to offer native integrations to their clients without the effort needed to maintain those native integrations. By using the APIs (Accounting, POS, eCommerce) of Chift, you connect once and allow your clients to use their software packages.

schema.title: Force Merge
schema.description: Indicate the ID of the corresponding supplier in the accounting system. Accounting systems using 1 entity to handle clients/customers and suppliers will merge the existing supplier with the new client/customer (if the parameter is filled in with the ID of an existing supplier).

get.description: Returns a list of journal entries. Each item will include the analytic account linked to default analytic plan. Optionnaly, you can retrieve journal entries linked to a specific client/supplier using the partner_id parameter. When retrieving entries linked to a specific client/supplier, some journal items of an entry (e.g. a miscellaneous operation) could be excluding resulting in an unbalanced journal entry.

parameters.name: folder_id

schema.title: Folder Id
schema.description: Accounting folder ID, this needs to be passed when activating the multiple folders feature.

parameters.description: Accounting folder ID, this needs to be passed when activating the multiple folders feature.

example.message: You can retrieve maximum 3 months of data at once. The difference between 'date_from' and 'date_to' is at maximum 3 months.

untaxed_amount_without_fees.title: Untaxed Amount Without Fees
untaxed_amount_without_fees.description: Untaxed amount without fees (e.g. shipping) but with discout. Refunds are not included.

tax_amount_without_fees.title: Tax Amount Without Fees
tax_amount_without_fees.description: Total taxes applied to the order without taxes linked to fees (e.g. shipping).

total_without_fees.title: Total Without Fees
total_without_fees.description: Total of the order without fees (e.g. shipping) but with discount. Refunds are not included.

untaxed_amount.title: Untaxed Amount
untaxed_amount.description: Untaxed amount with discout and any kind of fee (e.g. shipping). Refunds are not included.

tax_amount.title: Tax Amount
tax_amount.description: Total taxes applied to the order.

total.title: Total
total.description: Total of the order with discount. Refunds are not included.

currency.title: Currency
currency.description: Indicates the currency of the order (e.g. EUR).

payment_method_id.title: Payment Method Id
payment_method_id.description: Technical id of the payment method in the eCommerce

variant_id.title: Variant Id
variant_id.description: Technical id of the product variant in Chift

tax_rate.title: Tax Rate
tax_rate.description: Indicates the tax rate used for the line (e.g. 21.0).

unit_price.title: Unit Price
unit_price.description: Unit price of the product without taxes.

redirect.title: Redirect
redirect.description: Indicates whether you want to return to the consumer's redirectUrl after update (true) or whether you want to return on the connection page (false)

name.title: Name
name.description: Can be used to update the name of an existing connection

credentials.title: Credentials
credentials.description: Can be used to update the credentials of an existing connection. Please use the getIntegrations route to see the available credentials for each integration

amount.title: Amount
amount.description: Total amount of the payment. A part of this amount could be reconciled with another invoice.

dedicated_amount.title: Dedicated Amount
dedicated_amount.description: Amount of the payment dedicated to the invoice. Zero the accounting software doesn't provide the information.

source_ref.title: Source Ref
source_ref.description: Technical id in the target software

integrationid.title: Integrationid
integrationid.description: Can be used to specify the integration code of a specific connector. If specified, the url will will point directly to the connection page of the connector and will redirect on save to the redirect url of the consumer if specified.

name.title: Name
name.description: Can be used to specify the name of the connection. Must be used in combination with an integrationid.

credentials.title: Credentials
credentials.description: Can be used to specify the credentials of your connection. Must be used in combination with an integrationid and a name. Please use the getIntegrations route to see the available credentials for each integration
